comments.commentBody: The problem with MV is once you've done it, youv'e done it.  Ho Hum

Corn is popping

Wheat is whittling

Beans are already has-beens with the oil complex showing extreme inferiority

Crude has been acting rude

Lumber is in a slumber

Gold is already old

Silver is in a slider

Copper has been re-listed as badger

Currencies are gyrating like tops on their last spin

and finally, the Fed has fed the market with some laxatives to ease congestion...

A comment on the "rare miscommunication" between Peyton Manning and Reggie Wayne in the Super Bowl...

That was a variation of a play the Colts have run hundreds of times in the Manning era, especially in that down and distance situation (3rd and 5 from the Saints' 31 yard line). They align two wide receivers on the same side of the field and both run full-speed square-ins at exactly five yards.

The Colts try to make the play look a little different to create a brief moment of hesitation for the defense. They'll run it from a number of formations, with different personnel, varying the wide receiver splits, or, as in this case, with pre-snap motion.

They usually run it from a trips set with the tight end, Dallas Clark, on the same side of the two receivers, in the attached position (next to the offensive tackle). Clark will expand outside for two yards, then drive upfield and come across the middle at 15 yards. Manning will key the middle/inside linebacker. If the backer runs with Clark, he throws it to the slot receiver at five yards. If he doesn't, Manning will throw it to the outside receiver at five yards.

They rarely throw it to the tight end, the split end on the other side of the field, or the back swinging out of the backfield. It's a simple play that's been part of their base offense for years.

This time, Austin Collie went in motion toward the ball, released, and made his break inside at five yards, at the 26 yard line. Wayne, however, made his cut at six yards, not five, at the 25 yard line. That one yard made all the difference. The precise timing required between the quarterback and the receiver was lost.

Wayne appears to chop his feet at the break point. Sometimes this will freeze the defender and help him get open. It's an acceptable way to do it but it requires a split-second more time, and therefore allows the defensive back a greater opportunity to make a play on the ball. That's what appears to have happened here.

The usual method of making a square cut to the right is to plant the left foot in the ground, bend the knees, sink the hips, and push-off hard in the direction of the break. The receiver should always maintain forward body lean and transfer his weight with a quick and powerful step. It takes hundreds of reps to master, as young receivers tend to round off the break or drift upfield.

Tracy Porter's film study led him to quickly recognize the pattern and his anticipation put him in position to squat on the route, break on the ball, make the interception, and take off into history. All credit to him. However, if Wayne had made a clean square cut at the proper depth he would have crossed Porter's face and been in position to make the catch for the first down or, at minimum, to break up the play.

There are many reason why a given play turns out the way it does. In this particular instance, a miscommunication wasn't one of them.

Huh?
What's wrong with "City Boston" vs "Band Boston"?
How would anything or anyone know which one you're interested in, unless you specify?

And what does it mean to understand "relationships between things, like a band and its song lyrics"? Metaweb can figure out whether the lyrics to "More than a feeling" is really-really-really special, instead of "just special", with respect to how the band Boston feels about the song?

"Set Top"?  I think they're going to have to find a new word and a new place to store these gadgets..  My new set's top is about 2 inches deep, very sloped, has  speakers in it and is too high up to reach. At least my set is still housed in a closed cabinet though, and is not the conspicuous center of my living room.  Set top, indeed!
How does this differ from the Roku at half the price?

Cool.   I like Boxee for playing my movies.   I'm less enthusiastic about the tv component, since I just have never-ending problems trying to watch something with it messing up the video, the audio, the resolution quality, etc.   Too bad you can't integrate Hulu with Boxee -- yes, I know Hulu runs on Boxee but it's not a very good implementation.

wow, those guys are so cool and natural and real. can you believe the guy with the camera was so regular that he took some crackers to eat?? wow. how much can i buy it for? if i buy it, will those guys come over and hang with me? i bet they will.

mark of motormanmark.com
The best part is when the cameraman sneaks a Wheat Thin out of the box while Klein isn't watching. That, and the unbridled enthusiasm Klein has for what is a fresh take on the "Box" in Boxee.
When I called the support center this morning, the folks where very helpful. I had my email back by 11:30 with no issues.

Poster #1 I have twins that are 6 months old and I am a full-time working mom...do you know how hard it is for me to leave the house? Very hard...I order all baby stuff online and will be ordering drugstore stuff online too. All that's left now is food...and I used to order from freshdirect but we moved and they don't deliver here.

Steve Jobs, the real "Incredible" (Droid pun intended...), did a superb job with this 7/16/10 Conference! Between the video of it, and Antenna Page, now available on Apple's Site, the •• truth •• is out, and is speaks for itself!!!

I am trying to "chill", but the Apple Haters should be ashamed of this Antennagate Fiasco!!! They copy and badmouth Apple all at the same time, and shamelessly!

Shame on a bunch of bad media for exploiting this issue the way the did! The "15 Minutes of Fame" Syndrome knows no shame!

Too bad for the Class Action Suite Legal Vulters, and the AAPL Stock Manipulators, looking for a quick $$!!! Apple is a class act of a company with a bright future! May its CEO, Steve Jobs, live till 120!!! The haters would surely love to see him, a brave cancer survivor, go before his time!

I can't wait to get my iPhone 4 and Macbook Pro, as soon as I can fit my Upgrade into my schedule!!!! Today I want it even more than ever!

A proud Apple User I am!!!

Looks pretty cool but I care more about how it works.

Does it stream hulu, netflix, youtube, vimeo, etc? Some or all of these? Can it stream something like The Daily Show which is not on hulu but only on their website? What is the interface like? Will it play content purchased through iTunes?

Lots of questions still unanswered - basically all you're telling us is that you've designed a funky looking box...
What does it do?  Then I might care what it looks like.
How is the thing USED?

The neon-green 'kick-up' could be a wonderfully annoying 'look-at-me!' feature when users are watching television.

I don't know. This just seems like another set-top box to cram into the living room. Maybe this will be a big hit in, say, 10 years ago.

From the section above entitled " Not Many Complaints ".....

" This doesn't really jive ( sic ) with what you read about this problem ".....

Will you techies at Apple learn English? try " jibe " ( sic ). You give us enough jive already.
The Roku is out now and much cheaper. Along with NetFlix the internet selection is staggering. Why spend more on another box yet untested? At $200 they will have to be pretty amazing.
The video is not very informative.  What does the Boxee do?  As compared to  the Roke box for example.

I think the majority of us will care that we invested in apps and music on the itunes platform.  I can't see that I will buy Android for that reason, and I only have an ipod touch.  Trying to negotiate my family out of VZW's clutches is impossible.  For those of us with more limited budgets, family plans are lock-in and itunes is lock-in and I'm being pulled in two directions.
Merely another way to look at pictures. A change in screens. Wow!
maybe i'm missing something as a rather complete techonological idiot but I've watching the web on my 40 inch flat screen for a year with a 10 dollar HDMI cable (?)

I wonder if they use the same antenna in the wifi version of the IPAD? I bought an IPAD and it continually disconnected from my wireless network. Apple blamed ny network, but I have an IPOD touch and an Apple G4 laptop that never have a problem connecting to my network.  I sent the IPAD back because it was defective, but Apple ripped me off by charging a restocking fee.
I'd get one just for the remote - I already run Boxee on two computers but would love to have a keyboard on such a small device. Word is they'll be selling it separately.
Does it play the full internet or just restricted sites?
